Name: Village Park Restaurant
Address: 5, Jalan SS 21/37, Damansara Utama, 47400 Petaling Jaya, Selangor
Description: Legendary Nasi Lemak famous for its crispy spiced fried chicken and fluffy coconut rice. A favorite of locals and dignitaries alike.
Accessibility_Info: Ground floor shop lot. Accessible entrance but can be very crowded.
Public_Transport: MRT Kajang Line: TTDI Station (Take Feeder Bus T813 or Grab).

Name: Nasi Lemak Wanjo Kg Baru
Famous_Dish: Nasi Lemak with Sambal Sotong & Ayam Goreng
Address: 8, Jalan Raja Muda Musa, Kampung Baru, 50300 Kuala Lumpur
Description: One of the most authentic Nasi Lemak spots in the historic Kampung Baru area. Great for breakfast or late-night supper.
Accessibility_Info: Open-air ground floor seating. Wheelchair accessible.
Public_Transport: LRT Kelana Jaya Line: Kampung Baru Station (5-8 min walk).

Name: Hing Kee Bakuteh
Famous_Dish: Dry & Soup Bak Kut Teh (Pork Ribs)
Address: 121, Jalan Kepong, Metro Prima, 52100 Kuala Lumpur
Description: Michelin Bib Gourmand winner. Famous for its thick, aromatic herbal soup and the dry version with dried chilies and cuttlefish.
Accessibility_Info: Ground floor shop. Wheelchair accessible.
Public_Transport: MRT Putrajaya Line: Metro Prima Station (5 min walk).

Name: Canton Boy
Address: Lot G-012B, Ground Floor, MyTOWN Shopping Centre, Jalan Cochrane, 55100 KL
Description: A modern spot serving authentic Halal Dim Sum and Cantonese cuisine. Perfect for Muslim travelers craving Chinese-style breakfast.
Accessibility_Info: Fully wheelchair accessible (Mall elevators and ramps available).
Public_Transport: MRT Kajang Line: Cochrane Station (Direct underground link to MyTOWN).

Name: Kim Lian Kee
Address: 92, Jalan Hang Lekir, City Centre, 50000 Kuala Lumpur (Chinatown)
Description: The birthplace of KL Hokkien Mee. Uses charcoal fire to give the noodles a distinctive smoky 'wok hei' flavor. Uses pork lard.
Accessibility_Info: Ground floor seating available (tight space). Upper floor stairs only.
Public_Transport: MRT/LRT: Pasar Seni Station (Walk to Petaling Street).

Name: Ah Mang Mee (Stall No. 8)
Address: Stall No.8, Pusat Penjaja Seksyen 1/12, Jalan Othman, PJ Old Town, 46000 PJ
Description: A rare gem serving authentic-tasting Halal Hokkien Mee using chicken fat/skin instead of pork lard for that classic aroma.
Accessibility_Info: Hawker centre setting. Ground level, mostly accessible.
Public_Transport: Bus: PJ City Bus to PJ Old Town Terminal.

Name: Sri Nirwana Maju
Famous_Dish: Banana Leaf Rice with Fried Tenggiri or Chicken Varuval
Address: 43, Jalan Telawi 3, Bangsar, 59100 Kuala Lumpur
Description: Michelin Bib Gourmand. Famous for its long queues and 'Banjir' (flooded) curry style. No official Halal cert but serves no pork.
Accessibility_Info: Ground floor shop. Accessible entrance.
Public_Transport: LRT Kelana Jaya Line: Bangsar Station (Take Grab/Taxi, ~5 mins).

Name: Sate Kajang Hj Samuri
Famous_Dish: Chicken & Beef Satay with Peanut Sauce
Opening_Hours: Sat-Thu: 11:00 AM - 11:00 PM; Fri: 3:00 PM - 11:00 PM
Address: Jalan Hishammuddin, Bandar Kajang, 43000 Kajang, Selangor
Description: The most famous Satay chain in Malaysia. Known for its chunky meat skewers and thick, spicy peanut sauce.
Accessibility_Info: Ground floor/Restaurant setting. Wheelchair accessible.
Public_Transport: MRT Kajang Line: Stadium Kajang Station (Walking distance).

Name: Nam Heong Chicken Rice
Address: 56, Jalan Sultan, City Centre, 50000 Kuala Lumpur
Description: A heritage shop in Chinatown. Famous for its silky smooth steamed chicken and fragrant oily rice. Michelin Bib Gourmand.
Accessibility_Info: Ground floor shop. Accessible.
Public_Transport: MRT/LRT: Pasar Seni Station (5-10 min walk).

Name: Nasi Ayam Chee Meng
Address: 50, Jalan Bukit Bintang, 55100 Kuala Lumpur
Description: A certified Halal Hainanese chicken rice favorite in the heart of Bukit Bintang. Great for tourists and locals.
Accessibility_Info: Ground floor restaurant. Wheelchair accessible.
Public_Transport: Monorail/MRT: Bukit Bintang Station (Walking distance).

Name: Kin Kin Chili Pan Mee
Famous_Dish: Dry Chili Pan Mee (Flat Flour Noodles)
Address: 40, Jalan Dewan Sultan Sulaiman, Kampung Baru, 50300 Kuala Lumpur
Description: The originator of 'Chili Pan Mee'. Springy noodles topped with minced pork, fried anchovies, poached egg, and their signature dry chili flakes.
Accessibility_Info: Ground floor shop. Basic accessibility.
Public_Transport: Monorail: Medan Tuanku Station (5 min walk).

Name: Valentine Roti
Address: 1, Jalan Sultan Yahya Petra, Kampung Datuk Keramat, 54100 Kuala Lumpur
Description: Famous late-night supper spot. Their Roti Canai is known for being extra crispy and fluffy. Great with their dhal and mutton curry.
Accessibility_Info: Open-air roadside stall. Accessible flat ground.
Public_Transport: LRT Kelana Jaya Line: Dato' Keramat Station (10-15 min walk).

Name: Yut Kee Restaurant
Address: 1, Jalan Kamunting, Chow Kit, 50300 Kuala Lumpur
Description: One of KL's oldest Kopitiams (since 1928). Famous for its colonial-style Hainanese cuisine and marble cakes.
Accessibility_Info: Ground floor. Wheelchair friendly entrance.
Public_Transport: LRT Kelana Jaya Line: Dang Wangi Station (5 min walk).

Name: Damansara Uptown Hokkien Mee
Address: 117, 119, 121, Jalan SS 21/37, Damansara Utama, 47400 Petaling Jaya
Description: A cleaner, air-conditioned alternative for great Hokkien Mee. Open late and very consistent in taste.
Accessibility_Info: Ground floor shop. Accessible.
Public_Transport: MRT Kajang Line: TTDI Station (Take Grab/Taxi).

Name: Pure Saiva
Address: No 34, Jalan Yong Shook Lin, Bandar Baru Petaling Jaya, 46050 PJ
Description: High-quality South Indian Vegetarian food. Modern, clean setting. Famous for their extensive Thali sets and filter coffee.
Accessibility_Info: Modern shop, ground floor. Wheelchair accessible.
Public_Transport: LRT Kelana Jaya Line: Taman Jaya Station (Walking distance).

Name: Batu Caves
Address: Gombak, 68100 Batu Caves, Selangor
Description: Limestone hill featuring a series of caves and cave temples with a massive golden statue of Lord Murugan. famous for its 272 colorful steps.
Accessibility_Info: Ground level is accessible; Main Temple is NOT wheelchair accessible (272 steep steps).
Public_Transport: KTM Komuter: Batu Caves Station (Direct access).

Name: Petronas Twin Towers
Address: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, 50088 Kuala Lumpur
Description: World's tallest twin towers with a Skybridge and Observation Deck offering panoramic city views.
Accessibility_Info: Fully wheelchair accessible; elevators available to Skybridge and Observation Deck.
Public_Transport: LRT Kelana Jaya Line: KLCC Station (Direct access through Suria KLCC Mall).

Name: Sunway Lagoon
Address: 3, Jalan PJS 11/11, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Subang Jaya
Description: Huge multi-park destination with Water Park, Amusement Park, Wildlife Park, Extreme Park, Scream Park, and Nickelodeon Lost Lagoon.
Accessibility_Info: Wheelchair accessible pathways; wheelchairs available for rent; some rides have physical restrictions.
Public_Transport: BRT Sunway Line: Sunway Lagoon Station (Connects via KTM Setia Jaya or LRT USJ 7).

Name: KL Bird Park
Address: 920, Jalan Cenderawasih, Perdana Botanical Gardens, 50480 KL
Description: Renowned eco-tourism site; the world's largest free-flight walk-in aviary.
Accessibility_Info: Zone 1 & 2 are wheelchair friendly (paved); Zone 3 & 4 have slopes/stairs. No wheelchair rental on-site.
Public_Transport: Bus: KL Hop-On Hop-Off (Stop 14) or RapidKL Bus B115. MRT: Muzium Negara (20 min walk).

Name: National Museum (Muzium Negara)
Address: Jalan Damansara, Perdana Botanical Gardens, 50566 KL
Description: Malaysia's premier museum showcasing national history, culture, and heritage from prehistoric to modern times.
Accessibility_Info: Fully wheelchair accessible with ramps and elevators to all galleries.
Public_Transport: MRT Kajang Line: Muzium Negara Station (Exit B connects directly via pedestrian bridge).

Name: Aquaria KLCC
Address: Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre, Jalan Pinang, 50088 KL
Description: Oceanarium located beneath KL Convention Centre featuring a 90-meter underwater tunnel and over 5,000 exhibits.
Accessibility_Info: Fully wheelchair accessible; elevators and flat paths throughout exhibits.
Public_Transport: LRT Kelana Jaya Line: KLCC Station (Walk through undercover tunnel).

Name: Perdana Botanical Garden
Address: Jalan Kebun Bunga, Tasik Perdana, 55100 KL
Description: The oldest and most popular public park in KL, featuring orchid gardens, hibiscus gardens, and a deer park.
Accessibility_Info: Main paved paths are wheelchair accessible; some steep gradients in specific specialized gardens.
Public_Transport: MRT Kajang Line: Muzium Negara Station (15 min walk through museum connector).

Name: Islamic Arts Museum Malaysia
Address: Jalan Lembah Perdana, 50480 Kuala Lumpur
Description: Southeast Asia's largest museum of Islamic art, housing more than 10,000 artifacts from the Islamic world.
Accessibility_Info: Fully accessible with elevators and ramps; wheelchair accessible toilets available.
Public_Transport: Bus: GoKL City Bus (Red Line) - Stop at Masjid Negara.

Name: Zoo Negara
Address: Jalan Ulu Kelang, Kemensah Heights, 68000 Ampang, Selangor
Description: National zoo of Malaysia featuring over 476 species; famous for the Giant Panda Conservation Centre.
Accessibility_Info: Wheelchair accessible; Tram service included in ticket; Wheelchair rental available (RM5 + deposit).
Public_Transport: LRT Kelana Jaya Line: Wangsa Maju Station (Then take Taxi/Grab or RapidKL Bus 253).

Name: National Science Centre (Pusat Sains Negara)
Address: Persiaran Bukit Kiara, Bukit Damansara, 50662 KL
Description: Interactive science museum with hands-on exhibits, an aquarium tunnel, and outdoor science park. Great for kids.
Accessibility_Info: Fully accessible with elevators and ramps.
Public_Transport: MRT Kajang Line: Pusat Bandar Damansara (Then take feeder bus T818 or Grab).

Name: Sultan Salahuddin Abdul Aziz Shah Mosque (Blue Mosque)
Address: Persiaran Masjid, Sekysen 14, 40000 Shah Alam, Selangor
Description: The largest mosque in Malaysia, known for its massive blue and silver dome and stunning architecture.
Accessibility_Info: Wheelchair accessible areas available; elevators to prayer hall level.
Public_Transport: Bus: RapidKL Bus 750 from Pasar Seni to Shah Alam City Centre.

Name: I-City Shah Alam
Address: Jalan Multimedia, 7/AJ, City Park, i-City, 40000 Shah Alam
Description: Technology city famous for its LED 'City of Digital Lights', SnowWalk, and WaterWorld.
Accessibility_Info: Paved paths in main park area are wheelchair friendly; some rides not accessible.
Public_Transport: KTM Komuter: Padang Jawa Station (Then take free Smart Selangor Bus or Grab).

Name: Thean Hou Temple
Address: 65, Persiaran Endah, Taman Persiaran Desa, 50460 KL
Description: One of the oldest and largest temples in Southeast Asia, featuring 6 tiers of Chinese architecture and great city views.
Accessibility_Info: Elevators available to upper prayer halls; wheelchair ramps present.
Public_Transport: No direct train. Best: Grab/Taxi from KL Sentral or Mid Valley Megamall.

Name: Kwai Chai Hong
Address: Lorong Panggung, City Centre, 50000 Kuala Lumpur
Description: Restored heritage alleyway in Chinatown featuring interactive murals and hidden bars. Instagram hotspot.
Accessibility_Info: Ground level is flat and paved (cobblestones); mostly wheelchair accessible.
Public_Transport: MRT/LRT: Pasar Seni Station (Exit A, 5 min walk).

Name: KL Forest Eco Park (Bukit Nanas)
Address: Lot 240, Jalan Raja Chulan, Bukit Kewangan, 50250 KL
Description: Tropical rainforest reserve in the city center featuring a 200m canopy walk.
Accessibility_Info: Not fully wheelchair accessible (many stairs to canopy walk).
Public_Transport: Monorail: Bukit Nanas Station / GoKL Bus (Purple Line) - Stop at KL Tower.

Name: Putrajaya Wetlands Park (Taman Wetland)
Address: Presint 13, 62000 Putrajaya
Description: Largest constructed freshwater wetlands in the tropics; features nature trails, flamingo pond, and lookout tower.
Accessibility_Info: Paved trails are wheelchair and stroller friendly; tram service available.
Public_Transport: ERL: Putrajaya Sentral (Then take Nadi Putra Bus or Grab).

Name: Ilham Gallery
Address: Levels 3 & 5, Ilham Tower, 8, Jln Binjai, 50450 KL
Description: Public art gallery devoted to modern and contemporary Malaysian art, housed in the Ilham Tower.
Accessibility_Info: Fully wheelchair accessible; elevators and disabled restrooms available.
Public_Transport: LRT Kelana Jaya Line: Ampang Park Station (Exit is right next to Ilham Tower).

Name: Farm In The City
Address: Lot 40187-40188, Jalan Prima Tropika Barat, 43300 Seri Kembangan
Description: Petting zoo in a village-themed setting; allows visitors to feed and touch friendly animals like alpacas.
Accessibility_Info: Wheelchair friendly flat paths; strollers available for rent.
Public_Transport: MRT Putrajaya Line: Putra Permai Station (Short Grab ride or 15 min walk).
